result.execSummary:
The defendant Barnell L. Love was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Barnell L. Love is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Barnell L. Love was found guilty of Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to Count 4 16CF343, but, Concurrent to Count 1 in 16CF343.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Do not reside with any person in any place in which children reside w/o court's permission.  May not have contact with Vera B.  Not to reside w/ anyone of the opposite sex.

supervisions.notes:
Probation Revoked.
Consecutive to his ES sentence.
Any unpd court obligations are still to be collected.

superMiscConds.notes: ES conditions to be identical to those of probation unless already satisfied.

records.addlTxt: 2yrs WSP consec; initial confinement of 1yr followed by 1yr of ES.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP

Minutes:  15CM1011/16CF343/16CM5.  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA James Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Matt Jones.  Sentencing arguments made.

15CM1011 - deft sentenced to 2yrs WSP consecutive to his ES sentence; initial confinement of 1yr followed by 1yr of ES.  ES conditions to be identical to those of probation unless already satisfied.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.  Credit for 96 days.

16CM5 - deft sentenced to 2yrs WSP consecutive; initial confinement of 1yr followed by 1yr of ES.  ES conditions to be identical to those of probation unless already satisfied.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.  

16CF343 - deft sentenced to 4yrs WSP consecutive; initial confinement of 2yrs followed by 2yrs of ES.  ES conditions to be identical to those of probation unless already satisfied.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.

All sentences are CONSECUTIVE to each other and CONSECUTIVE to the deft's ES sentence.
Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.  Voting acknowledgment.

Minutes:  15CM1011/16CF343/16CM5.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Kristyne Watson.  Victim rights compliance.  Oral corrections made to PSI by defense.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentencing hrg interrupted by the Court prior to imposition of sentence.  Court wants to review the police reports and/or charging documents from the Illinois offense of sexual abuse/force.  Balance of sentencing hrg adj to 6/30/16 @ 10am.  Court requests the State attempt to obtain these documents prior to next hrg.

Special Prosecutor K. Richard Wells appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Kristyne Watson.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Count 2 - Dismissed on State motion.  Count 1 - Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 6/8/16 at 10:30 a.m.  Bond continued.

Minutes:  15CM1011/16CF343/16CM5.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Kristyne Watson.  Defense requests an adjournment; deft has new charges - prelim was 4/6/16.  New global offer extended.  FPT adj to 4/18/16 @ 1:15pm.

Minutes:  16CM5/15CM1011.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Kristyne Watson.  Defense requests an adjournment to further discuss the plea offer w/deft.  FPT 4/8/16 @ 9am, JS 4/25/16 @ 9am along w/co-defts.

Minutes:  15CM1011 & 16CM5.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Kristyne Watson.  Bond forfeiture is vacated.  Defense counsel requests the new file of 16CM5 be scheduled for the same dates as the co-deft cases.  15CM1011 will be given the same dates.  No objection from the State.  FPT 2/25/16 @ 1:40pm, JS 3/14/16 @ 9am.

235pm  Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk: NJurgens.  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.
